EXISTING STRUCTURES
--------------------
### Electricity generator at position (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following interconnected power components:
• Steam engine (“steam-engine”) at (-0.5, 24.5)
• Boiler at (-5.5, 24.0)
• Offshore pump at (-7.5, 25.5)

### Copper cable factory interface at position (2.5, 17.5)
Serves as the input and conversion point for copper plates into copper cable.
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT – its neighbours include a burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) and an assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)

### Belt depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Provides an isolated belt target for connecting the extraction system to the factory interface.
Consists of:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) at (3.5, 15.5)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) with a pickup position at (3.5, 15.5) and a drop position at (3.5, 13.5)

### Extraction system at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Functions as the source side for transferring copper plates.
Consists of:
• Extraction system burner inserter at (-3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (-3.5, 28.5)

ERROR TIPS
----------
• Belt Connection Errors  
  – Ensure that the target for a transport belt connection is not a steam engine. Instead, route items through an inserter that feeds into the device. Verify the type of the target entity before attempting to connect belts.

• Placement Distance Errors  
  – Before placing an entity, confirm that the target position is within the maximum allowed distance from the player. Move closer if the calculated distance exceeds the placement limit.

• Undefined Variable Errors  
  – Check that all variable names used (for example, referencing “target_chest”) are defined correctly. Ensure consistency in variable naming to avoid NameError issues.

• Inventory Availability Errors  
  – Verify that the required item (such as a wooden chest) is present in the player’s inventory before attempting its placement.
